args:
The promised time arrives, but despite the
group's best efforts, Lapis makes off with Bella.
The next day, a ransom letter arrives from the
Blue Rose, but the group must put in a show to
afford it, forcing Karina to perform in the place
of the stolen soprano.
I know the boss said they could\nall come stay at the castle...
But I didn't expect them to bring the entire\ntheater along with them.
I never thought to see an opera house\nstanding in our courtyard.
I still wonder what they meant by\n＂strike the set.＂

Then let me enlighten you with a little bit
of theater magic! To strike a set is to
dismantle and pack it away so it might be
used again in some other time and place.
But as we are a traveling company,\nstriking a set entails dismantling our\nentire opera house.
I then swallow all the attendant parts\nfor safe transport.
And then stick it all together again once\nya get where yer goin'? Seems like a\nhelluva lotta work, don't it?
Indeed, sir! Bravo! I couldn't have said\nit better myself—although perhaps with\nslightly more refined grammar.
I'm just amazed how clean everything is\nconsidering it was just in your gut...
Yeah, the stuff that comes from my gut\nisn't NEARLY as pretty.
Ah, well, I am a rather fastidious sort.
You're not wrong to wonder about that;\nit's actually quite the little mystery among\nthe rest of the troupe.
By the way, do you truly believe it is safe\nfor me to be here right now?
I'm pleased to be rehearsing, of course,\nbut seeing as how I have been marked...
I talked with everyone, and we all agree\nthis opera house is the safest place for\nyou to be at the moment.
The idea is to maximize our strengths\nas a traveling troupe!

When the prognosticated day arrives
we'll simply rebuild the opera house in a
different layout, rendering any scouting
about its construction utterly useless.
We'll make it so there's only one way in\nor out, which makes it easier to defend.
And with a wide space like this,\nwe can station plenty of guards.

Plus, if you're on stage, it means everyone
can see you. I don't care how good this
＂phantom thief＂ is, she's not going to grab
you from under our noses like that.
So just try to relax, all right?

But redesigning the opera house is an
incredible undertaking! I can't possibly
make myself such a burden on the rest
of the troupe...
We've all agreed to pitch in and help.\nThe important thing here is that you\nremain safe and sound.
One week later\nThe day foretold by Lapis
Oh, I do love to hear them sing...\nAhoy {player_name},\nit's time for the changing of the guard.
I'm going to stay put, actually.\nIf this is the moment the Blue Rose\nplans to strike, I want to be here for it.
There's no such thing as being too\nprepared for something like this.
You really think someone can break though\nALL of this security and nab our Bella?\nI don't know...

I mean, the most important thing for a
good plundering is a solid escape route.
If you can't escape with your booty,
what's the point?

We've got Ranzal and Luca covering the
entrance, Elisanne and Cleo in the wings,
and even MORE units sprinkled backstage
and in the house. Isn't that enough?
It certainly does seem to be secure.
And even if Lapis got in, I don't see how\nshe could get out aga—
The lights are back... What WAS that?
Ya hear that just now, boss?!
It sounded like some kind of explosion\njust before the whole place went dark.\nIs everything alright outside?
Yeah, I left Luca standin' watch, and ain't\nnobody but me been back here since.
But HOW!? She was singing right\nbeside me just a moment ago!
There is no sign of a break-in either\nbackstage or in the wings.
Wait. Look there, on the stage.\n...A blue rose.
It's Lapis. The phantom thief has taken our\nbeloved songstress! O unhappy day!\nO woe! O misery!
Spread out and search everywhere!\nShe can't have gotten far considering\nshe's carrying a person!
Tsk! Did you truly think your little\n＂security measures＂ would be enough\nto stop moi?
Bonsoir, mes amis! It is a pleasure\nto make your acquaintances!
I am she who sees the impossible done...\nThe phantom thief! The Blue Rose! Lapis!\nMark my name and remember it well.
What have you done with Bella?!
I've invited the Noble Flower to stay in my\nspecial collection room.
Ah, to think that beautiful voice will be\nmine to hear every day from now on...
Hmph! You know, when they mentioned\nthis phantom thief everyone's so scared of,\nI wasn't really sure what to expect.
But Bella's beautiful voice will clearly be\nwasted on a sneaky cutpurse like you!
And I suppose I should leave her here to\nentertain a boorish buccaneer like you?
Oh ho ho! Did you think it would be\nthat easy, mes amis?
I have what I came for. Au revoir, darlings!
We searched every town and village near\nthe castle, boss, but there ain't no sign of\nBella OR Lapis.
And I searched the Mistholt from top\nto bottom and came up empty.
I see. Thank you both. We'll just have to\nwait and see what the others find for now.
I'm so sorry. We swore to keep her safe,\nand we failed you.
It is not your fault; the phantom thief Lapis\nalways gets what she comes for.
It was over the moment she left her card.
＂If you want your Noble Flower back,\nprepare 10,000,000 rupies and...＂\nHeavens, is this a RANSOM note?!
Then she was only after money this\nentire time? How despicable!
Strange. I've never heard tell of Lapis\nseeking ransom before.
She's rotten to her core, that one;\nno reason to think a ransom beneath her.
Still, ten million rupies? We'll have to\nstage a production to raise that much.
Say, you're friendly with the songstress\nLucretia, are you not?
Do you think she might be willing\nto play understudy for our Bella?
Unfortunately, Lucretia is out on tour\nat the moment.
Alas! Well, do you happen to have any\nother skilled singers among your ranks?
We have Pia and Elias, but they are both\nfar too young to take on Bella's role.
Guys! GUYS! I totally know who can do it!
That's right. If we're going to save Bella,\nwe need you to play her role in the opera.
Well, I'm not half the singer she is,\nbut I'm certainly willing to give it a shot.
Thank you so much, gentle pirate!
Aw, you're gonna make me blush.\nSo what's the part, anyway?
Here is the book. Peruse it at your leisure.
...Wait. You want me to sing THIS?!
